alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Goshen County; Laramie Valley; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 9:19AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: A large region of surface high pressure, originating from Canada, continues to slowly move across the northern Plains and Central Rockies. This area of Canadian high pressure will persist across our forecast area. Along with this Canadian high pressure, areas of dense smoke from Canadian Wildfires located in Alberta and Saskatchewan has moved into southeast Wyoming. This dense smoke has spread across Wyoming and the Nebraska Panhandle overnight, reducing outdoor visibilities below two miles at times. The smoke will continue to spread south and west through the remainder of the day and tonight, ultimately continuing into Saturday. If you are outdoors please be extra cautious and avoid prolonged exposure to smoke.
